Laura Lindeman

Nice to meet you!

Read my blog at:

blog.lauralindeman.com

Hosted on GitHub Pages — Theme by orderedlist

  • voracious reader & crafter of words.
  • blogger.
  • organizer extraordinaire.
  • bargain hunter.

I spent two formative high-school years at The Mississippi School for Mathematics and Science before attending Birmingham-Southern College, where I graduated summa cum laude with a BA in English. I worked as a non-profit professional in Huntsville, AL and in Atlanta, GA, where I managed the office, tracked and acknowledged donations, and assisted with fundraising events. I cultivated a love for the tech community through my efforts to learn to code and worked at The Iron Yard Atlanta as the Assistant Campus Director. I geeked out over community building, scheduling, and event logistics. I'm currently living out 4-year-old Laura's dream of being a writer by creating content for my blog and seeking opportunities to contribute to the Internet of Words as a copywriter or editor.

Offline I enjoy hiking and backpacking with my husband. The kitchen is my happy place, and I'm always trying out new recipes that I find on Pinterest. I'm a firm proponent of the Oxford comma and somewhat pedantic about the conventions of the 4-way stop. I seem to collect funky earrings and cardigans. I enjoy monthly meetings with my book club, where we sometimes talk about the book we've read (anything from pop fiction to literature to non-fiction!) but also drink wine and eat lots of cheese. In 2015 I'm structuring my reading based on Book Riot's Read Harder challenge. You can follow along!

Connect with me!
